thread.title: Top Data Center Operator Near High After Q2 Results
thread.title_full: Top Data Center Operator Near High After Q2 Results

title: Top Data Center Operator Near High After Q2 Results
text:
Top Data Center Operator Near High After Q2 Results Mon, Aug 03 2015 00:00:00 E B11_NYSETOP BY ANDREW EDWARDS , INVESTOR'S BUSINESS DAILY 06:12 PM ET Comment 
E quinix (NASDAQ: EQIX ) is in buy range past a 274.23 buy point from a shallow cup pattern.Shares broke out July 24 in just average trade, but climbed for five straight sessions. The stock's RS line hit a new high as it broke out, helping confirm the move. The base was early-stage after a big reset in 2013. 
On Wednesday, Equinix reported that Q2 revenue expanded by 10%, extending a long streak of double-digit gains. 
It was the slowest growth in at least 19 quarters, as gains modestly decelerated from 14% to 10% over the past three quarters. 
According to the company's Q2 presentation, Equinix has delivered 50 quarters of consecutive revenue growth. 
Equinix operates large-scale data centers to protect and connect valued information assets. 
The company operates 105 global centers covering more than 11 million square feet. Equinix had approximately 6,300 global customers in Q2 and generated roughly half of its revenue in the U.S. 
It's the second highest rated member of the Internet networking industry group, with a 96 Composite Rating, behind just LogMeIn (NASDAQ: LOGM ). LogMeIn also broke out July 24 on an earnings-inspired gap. Other stocks in the group, such as Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ: AKAM ), are working on bases. 
In May, Equinix announced a $3.5 billion acquisition of Telecity, significantly stepping up its European exposure. 
It also received a favorable response from the IRS regarding its conversion to a Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) for tax purposes. Equinix began operating as a REIT at the beginning of the year. 
The Redwood City, Calif.-based company will pay a $1.69-per-share quarterly dividend on Sept. 16 to holders of record on Aug. 26. 
At current prices, shares yield about 2.4% annually. 
The stock is up more than 20% year to date. Stocks Open Up In Soft Trade; Earnings Stir Big Moves 
The market opened to slender gains Wednesday, as earnings reports triggered big moves up and down across a broad swath of industry sectors. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 0.3%. The S&P 500 added 0.2%, and the Nasdaq clung to a gain of less than 0.1% in early trade. The stock market today ... 07/29/2015 11:31 AM ET Apple TV Delay Crushes Akamai Stock, Guidance Light 
Akamai Technologies reported Q2 profit that missed views amid network investments tied to the delayed launch of Web TV services by Apple, sending its stock down late Tuesday. Akamai's (NASDAQ:AKAM) current quarter EPS and revenue guidance also fell short of expectations. Marcus & Millichap (NYSE:MMI) has been trading tightly near a 49.98 buy point since breaking out on July 22. Heart-pump maker Abiomed has added a handle to its latest base, carving out a buy point at 76.70. Shares have held up well during recent market turmoil and are about 1% off an all-time high. Outerwall (NASDAQ:OUTR) is holding near highs ahead of its Q2 earnings report on Thursday after the close. Property and casualty insurer Universal Insurance Holdings (NYSE:UVE) is near a 27.49 buy point after a powerful breakout on Friday.
